data.title: Way to contact extension authors/leave feedback
data.body: There doesn't seem to be any way in the extension manager or marketplace to contact the authors of extensions installed. I've found a need for the documentation to be fixed and there's no way of telling the author unless I leave a review. There NEEDS to be a means to directly communicate with the extension manager, there is a changelog after all, so I imagined there'd be some sort of version control system.

data.title: Add 'Does it repro without extensions?' to issue templates
Support onLanguage-activation with scheme (document selector)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Linux Mint

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Generate a new extension (`yo code`)
2. Set `activationEvents` in **package.json**:
    ```json
    "activationEvents": [
        "onLanguage:plaintext"
    ],
    ```
3. Add the following line to `activate` in **extension.[tj]s**:
    ```js
    console.log('Workspace files: ' + vscode.workspace.textDocuments.map(d => d.fileName).join(', '));
    ```
4. Hit F5 to debug the extension

### Observed Behavior:
If the welcome screen is displayed, the extension is activated and **/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/parts/welcome/page/electron-browser/vs_code_welcome_page** is listed as a workspace file. (which I conclude to mean triggered the activation).  Inspecting the URI shows it has the **walkThrough:/** scheme.

If you are in a git repository opening any type of file caused the extension to be activated by a file ending in **.git** (dot git).  Inspecting the URI shows this file has the scheme, **git:/**

### Expected behavior:
Extensions not be activated for these virtual files because it does not make sense to check or interact with them  Alternatively, there should be a way to specify which schemes should activate an extension.

Note: My expectation here also applies to `documentSelector` behavior in `LanguageClientOptions` in **vscode-languageclient**.  I can open an issue for that if desired.
___
Affected extension: adamvoss/vscode-languagetool#2

data.title: Feature Request: Add Setting to open VS Code without default unsaved tab being opened [closed as duplicate]
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Close all files/tabs in VS code.
2. Close VS code.
3. Open VS code.

The application will open up with a default `Untitled-1` tab already open that you can start typing into.
It would be nice to have a setting that allows VS Code to start without opening any tabs. e.g. it looks like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1187140/27140993-40ef410c-50e4-11e7-995c-36b82fbf0e52.png)

The reason this is desirable is I often open VS Code and then open the file I'm after, by using Ctrl+O or the `File -> Open Recent` menu. This means always having to close the default tab that VS code opened when it started, which is annoying.

Alternatively, you could perhaps still have the default blank tab open with VS Code, but close it automatically once any other file is opened and that tab is still blank.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (fda3ed38449fea27b97698ad0950c2870bf6afaa, 2017-06-14T05:13:12.994Z)

|---|---|---|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|

|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.4|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.3|
|java|redhat|0.5.0|;


---
If I use the integrated terminal for executing _watch_ scripts, or any _background_ running tasks, shouldn't it terminate automatically upon closing vscode?
Steps to Reproduce:
For simplicity, create a [CRA](https://github.com/facebookincubator/create-react-app) app and open it in vscode. 
1. Open the Integrated Terminal and execute `npm start`
2. Close the vscode window and try to access `http://localhost:3000`.  

It doesn't have to be a [CRA](https://github.com/facebookincubator/create-react-app) app. Try running `express` or a http server instance.

data.title: Reopen/Save with encoding in menu and command panel
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open command panel
2. Type `reopen` or `open with` or `encoding`
3. You get no results

Expected is to see these options, however they popup only upon clicking on encoding at status bar.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2313018/27132690-14690808-5110-11e7-8300-45ca20d1bbc1.png)

Moreover, the _Reopen ..._ and _Save with Encoding_ are not in File menu as found in some other text editors. Unless user tries and more/less randomly clicks the encoding at status bar, there is no way to discover how to actually reopen/save a file with particular encoding.

data.title: Use native Map for BoundMap
data.body: The `BoundMap` implementation can be a lot simpler by using a native Map because (1) it support `size` out of the box and (2) because it allows to [traverse](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map/forEach) its elements in insertion order.

After I uninstall some extension no matter how (from the uninstall button in the extensions page or from a command line) the extensions appears again.

1. Open VS Code as administrator

data.title: Add a shortcut to select the file from the sidebar without moving cursor to the editor
data.body:
Currently it is difficult to check the contents of multiple files from the sidebar without using the mouse, because the default select action moves the cursor into the editor.

When using the mouse you can just click on the files to preview them, but using cmd+enter moves the cursor into editor area. (using list.select action)

It would be great to add a new action that previews the file in the editor without moving the cursor into it, that works exactly the same as the mouse click. Using space as shortcut would work great on macOS.

Below is the screen recording that shows that it's difficult to preview multiple files. It shows the following actions:

1. clicking with the mouse (does not move the cursor into editor, allows previewing easily)
2. enter (renames instead of previewing)
3. cmd+enter (moves the cursor into editor, difficult for preview)

![preview-files-gif](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22099097/27127770-f59bbc14-5104-11e7-830c-c881eff988b1.gif)

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

data.title: editor hangs for 10-15s after regaining focus

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open VSCode
2. work a couple of minutes
3. move to another app (chrome)
4. move back to vscode = freezing for 10-15 seconds

I have tried to run with the disable-extensions command, clean installed it, closed minimap, tried the insders version - nothing helped. 

Can you suggest a way to find the cause ?

Windows is operating normally in the meantime, nothing else is frozen.

data.title: version 1.13 and ohmyzsh integrated terminal flickering branches
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13
- OS Version: Debian 8

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use oh my zsh and integrated terminal
2. Notice how in your git repo you will see folderpath branch:branch (why showing branches 2times)
3. Notice how when you start typing in integrated terminal it will stop displaying branch 2 times but rather once

This removing and adding of branch name causes flickering since it happens on an time scale of > 1s. 

Can't find any change description in https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_13#_changed-setting-defaults that would cause this.
